dt: {bc}a slender pointed rod for holding meat over a fire
{bc}a small point of land especially of sand or gravel running into a body of water

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}spitu{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}spiz{/it} spit, {it}spizzi{/it} pointed
shortdef: a slender pointed rod for holding meat over a fire
a small point of land especially of sand or gravel running into a body of water

dt: {bc}to fix on or as if on a spit {bc}{sx|impale||}

shortdef: to fix on or as if on a spit : impale

dt: {bc}to express (unpleasant or malicious feelings) by or as if by {a_link|spitting}
{bc}to utter with a spitting sound or scornful expression
{bc}to emit (precipitation) in driving particles or in flurries
{bc}to eject saliva as an expression of aversion or contempt
{bc}to eject matter (such as saliva) from the mouth {bc}{sx|expectorate||}
{bc}to rain or snow slightly or in flurries
{bc}to say what is in the mind without further delay

et: Middle English {it}spitten{/it}, from Old English {it}spittan{/it}; akin to Middle High German {it}spiutzen{/it} to spit
shortdef: to eject (something) from the mouth : expectorate
to express (unpleasant or malicious feelings) by or as if by spitting
to utter with a spitting sound or scornful expression

dt: {bc}a sprinkle of rain or flurry of snow

shortdef: the act or an instance of spitting
a frothy secretion exuded by spittlebugs

cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}extreme attention to cleanliness, orderliness, smartness of appearance, and ceremony often at the expense of operational efficiency

et: from the practice of polishing objects such as shoes by spitting on them and then rubbing them with a cloth
shortdef: extreme attention to cleanliness, orderliness, smartness of appearance, and ceremony often at the expense of operational efficiency

dt: {bc}a spiral curl that is usually plastered on the forehead, temple, or cheek

et: probably from its being sometimes plastered down with saliva
shortdef: a spiral curl that is usually plastered on the forehead, temple, or cheek

dt: {bc}the act of spitting out one's drink in response to something funny or surprising especially for comedic effect

dt.t: Whether you're grading on difficulty or execution, this {wi}spit take{/wi} is nearly a perfect ten. [Stephen] Colbert maintains a perfect 25-degree angle-of-spew throughout the duration—nearly an entire second—while effortlessly hitting the kind of water throughput levels more commonly seen in aqueduct design than comedy sketches.
If this morning's news had you doing a {wi}spit take{/wi} over your morning coffee, don't worry, Keurig Dr Pepper is happy to sell you another cup.

When his name is announced as a best director nominee, Tarantino performs an epic {wi}spit-take{/wi}, proving that the wanton spraying of bodily fluids is a personal proclivity as well as a cinematic one.
College prices have long provoked headshaking, but in recent years they've been more likely to cause a {wi}spit-take{/wi}.

shortdef: the act of spitting out one's drink in response to something funny or surprising especially for comedic effect

dt.t: She's 80 years old but still full of {it}spit and vinegar{/it}.
